item.title: 交易商称，印度尼西亚可能难以兑现对美国农产品进口的新承诺
item.description: 交易商表示，印度尼西亚可能难以兑现其在新贸易协议下大幅增加美国农产品进口的承诺，而大幅增加美国豆粕采购的重担将落在新成立的负责购买动物饲料的国家机构身上。【原文：Indonesia could struggle to meet its pledge for a significant ramp-up of U.S. agricultural imports under its new trade deal, traders said, with the burden of vastly increasing U.S. soymeal purchases falling on a state agency newly tasked to buy animal feed.】

item.title: 京东创始人推出游艇品牌
item.description: 中国电商巨头京东创始人刘强东近日推出独立游艇品牌"海拓"，致力于打造"100%绿色"游艇，让普通家庭也能负担得起。【原文：The founder of Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com , Richard Liu, has launched an independent yacht brand, Sea Expandary, aiming to build "100% green" yachts that will be affordable for ordinary households.】

item.title: 小米就专利使用费关税问题向印度税务部门提出质疑，此案备受关注
item.description: 据法律文件显示，小米公司已对印度税务部门的一项裁决提出异议。该裁决认定小米在专利使用费支付中逃避了7200万美元关税。这家中国公司及其律师表示，此案是对印度合同制造法律框架的一次考验。【原文：Xiaomi has challenged an Indian tax ruling that said the company evaded $72 million in tariffs on royalty payments, according to legal documents, a dispute that the Chinese company and lawyers say is a test of the country's legal framework for contract manufacturing.】

item.title: 独家：高盛集团拟向字节跳动出售股份，估值达5500亿美元
item.description: 知情人士透露，投资公司General Atlantic正出售其持有的字节跳动股权，该交易对这家中国社交媒体巨头的估值达5500亿美元，标志着这家私营企业的股价大幅上涨。【原文：Investment firm General Atlantic is selling an equity stake in ByteDance in a deal that values the Chinese social media giant at $550 billion, two people with knowledge of the matter said, marking a dramatic rise in the privately held shares.】

item.title: 日经报道：微软日本因涉嫌违反反垄断法遭突击搜查
item.description: 日本公平交易委员会周三突击搜查了微软日本公司办公室，作为调查其是否不当限制Azure平台客户使用竞争对手云服务的一部分。日本经济新闻援引知情人士消息报道了此事。【原文：Japan's Fair Trade Commission raided Microsoft Japan's offices on Wednesday as part of an investigation into whether it improperly restricted customers of its Azure platform from using rival cloud services, the Nikkei business daily reported, citing sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局称，宝马将召回近5.9万辆存在线束损坏问题的汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周三表示，宝马因空调系统线束可能受损导致短路，将在美国召回58,713辆汽车。【原文：BMW is recalling 58,713 vehicles in the U.S. due to a wiring harness for the air conditioning system that may be damaged and cause a short circuit, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 字节跳动旗下AI聊天机器人豆包在春节期间以1亿用户量赢得中国假日争夺战
item.description: 字节跳动的聊天机器人豆包在春节期间日活跃用户突破一亿，在一场人工智能大战中胜出。据私营机构调查显示，中国最大科技公司为获取新用户投入了数十亿资金。【原文：ByteDance's Doubao chatbot attracted over 100 million daily active users during China's Lunar New Year holiday, winning an AI battle that saw the country's largest tech companies spend billions to acquire new users, a private survey showed.】

item.title: 印度塔塔咨询服务公司首席执行官称，尽管存在营收风险，仍敦促员工使用人工智能技术
item.description: 印度最大软件服务供应商塔塔咨询服务公司首席执行官周三表示，该公司正敦促员工使用人工智能工具来更快、更便宜地完成工作，即使这会侵蚀公司收入。【原文：Tata Consultancy Services is urging employees to use artificial intelligence tools to deliver work faster and cheaper, even if it eats into the company's revenue, the CEO of India's largest software-services provider said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 摩根大通预计2026年底金价将达每盎司6300美元
item.description: 摩根大通周三在一份报告中表示，预计今年央行和投资者的需求将最终推动金价在2026年底前升至每盎司6300美元。【原文：JP Morgan sees demand from central banks and investors this year ultimately pushing gold prices to $6,300 an ounce by end-2026, JP Morgan said in a note on Wednesday.】

item.title: 帝亚吉欧再次下调业绩预期，削减股息，因中美需求疲软
item.description: 帝亚吉欧在四个月内第二次下调年度销售额和利润预期，并大幅削减股息。这家全球最大烈酒生产商在新任首席执行官戴夫·刘易斯领导下的首份财报显示，美国和中国市场需求疲软仍在拖累其业绩。【原文：Diageo cut its annual sales and profit forecast for the second time in four months and slashed its dividend, as its first results under new boss Dave Lewis showed weak U.S. and Chinese demand still weighing on the world's biggest spirits maker.】

item.title: OPmobility报告2025年利润率增长，确认布雷尔担任首席执行官
item.description: OPmobility周三公布了2025年利润增长预期，并正式任命菲莉西·布雷尔为首席执行官。这家法国汽车零部件供应商正持续推进多元化战略。【原文：OPmobility on Wednesday reported 2025 margin growth and confirmed Félicie Burelle as its chief executive officer as the French car parts supplier continues to pursue a diversification strategy.】

item.title: 早盘竞价：亚洲科技股吹起人工智能泡沫
item.description: 韦恩·科尔为您解析欧洲及全球市场今日展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole.】

item.title: 汇丰上调盈利目标，年度利润下滑但超出预期
item.description: 汇丰控股上调关键盈利目标，此前其年度利润超出预期。此举表明该行大部分计划中的改革现已完成，并已将目光投向进一步增长。【原文：HSBC Holdings lifted a key earnings target after its annual profit beat expectations, a decision which reflects that most of the bank's planned overhaul has now been completed and further growth is in its sights.】

item.title: 特朗普表示他已要求大型科技公司自建发电厂
item.description: 特朗普总统周二在国情咨文演讲中表示，其政府已要求主要科技公司为数据中心自建发电厂，此举旨在保护消费者免受电费上涨的影响。【原文：President Donald Trump said on Tuesday during his State of the Union address that his administration has told major technology companies they must build their own power plants for their data centers, a measure meant to protect consumers from rising bills.】

item.title: 印度股市因686亿美元IT股暴跌落后于区域同行，人工智能担忧加剧市场动荡
item.description: 印度股市在2月份迄今的表现落后于亚洲及新兴市场同行，因投资者担忧人工智能相关领域可能引发的动荡，导致信息技术类股市值暴跌686亿美元。【原文：Indian shares have lagged their Asian and emerging market peers so far in February, pressured by a $68.6 billion rout in the market value of information technology stocks, as investors fretted over disruptions linked to artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 特朗普向国会发表国情咨文演讲的要点
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普于周二向国会两院联席会议发表国情咨文演讲，这可能是关键时刻——白宫正试图在11月中期选举前巩固共和党选民的支持。【原文：President Donald Trump delivered his State of the Union address to a joint session of Congress on Tuesday, a potentially pivotal moment as the White House seeks to firm up support among Republican voters ahead of November's midterm elections.】

item.title: 澳大利亚必胜客企业公布下半年开局惨淡；股价暴跌
item.description: 澳大利亚必胜客企业周三报告称，受德国和荷兰恶劣天气影响，下半年初期同店销售额增长大幅下滑，导致其股价暴跌16%。【原文：Australia's Domino's Pizza Enterprises reported a sharp drop in early second-half same-store-sales growth on Wednesday, due to severe weather conditions in Germany and Netherlands, triggering a 16% share slide.】

item.title: 亚洲股市因人工智能情绪好转而上涨，特朗普演讲备受期待
item.description: 亚洲金融市场周三走高，韩国芯片制造商领涨，投资者加码押注他们认为最安全的人工智能（AI）领域，而日元仍受关注。【原文：Asia's financial markets were higher on Wednesday with Korean chipmakers leading gains, as investors double down on what they see as the safest bet on artificial intelligence (AI), while the yen remained in focus.】

item.title: 油价在美伊会谈前徘徊于七个月高点附近
item.description: 周三油价徘徊在近七个月高位附近，尽管美伊双方定于周四举行会谈，但两国之间可能引发军事冲突并导致供应中断的威胁仍令投资者忧心忡忡。【原文：Oil prices were hovering near seven-month highs on Wednesday as the threat of military conflict between the U.S. and Iran that could disrupt supply continues to worry investors even as talks between the parties are set for Thursday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，现代汽车将在韩国投资机器人技术和数据中心
item.description: 据消息人士周三透露，现代汽车集团计划在韩国西海岸新万金地区进行重大投资，涉及机器人技术、数据中心、氢能基础设施及其他开发项目。【原文：Hyundai Motor Group is planning a major investment in robotics, a data centre and hydrogen infrastructure and other developments in South Korea's west coast area of Saemangeum, a source said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 日元承压，因高市报告；澳元因通胀数据走高
item.description: 周三，日元汇率持续震荡，徘徊在两周低点附近。此前有报道称，首相高市早苗向央行行长表示对未来加息持保留态度。与此同时，人民币汇率持续走强，对美元构成持续压力。【原文：A wobbly yen was pinned near a two-week low on Wednesday after a report that Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi had told the central bank chief she had reservations about future rate hikes, while a steadily rising Chinese yuan kept pressure on the dollar.】

item.title: 澳大利亚通胀率超预期，核心通胀达16个月高位，加息风险加剧
item.description: 澳大利亚1月份消费者价格涨幅超出预期，核心通胀率升至一年多来最高水平。这对政策制定者而言是个令人不安的结果，增加了再次加息的风险。【原文：Australian consumer prices rose by more than expected in January, while core inflation hit the highest in over a year, an uncomfortable outcome for policymakers that raises the risk of another hike in interest rates.】

item.title: 日本服务业通胀保持稳定，显示工资驱动的价格压力
item.description: 数据显示，日本服务业价格领先指标1月份同比上涨2.6%，这表明劳动力市场紧张导致的工资上涨持续给经济带来通胀压力。【原文：A leading indicator of Japan's services sector prices rose 2.6% in January from a year earlier, data showed on Wednesday, a sign rising wages from a tight labour market continued to pile inflationary pressure on the economy.】

item.title: 巴西法官推翻暂停餐券制度改革的决定
item.description: 巴西一名法官支持政府立场，推翻了此前暂停修改餐券系统的法院裁决。该系统涉及Pluxee和Edenred旗下的Ticket等公司。周二公布的裁决显示。【原文：A Brazilian judge sided with the government and overruled previous court decisions that had suspended changes to the meal voucher system for companies including Pluxee and Edenred's Ticket, the ruling showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 最高法院裁决后，投资者为关税退税索赔支付的费用激增
item.description: 美国最高法院裁定特朗普总统的紧急关税措施违法后，进口商出售政府退税权利所能获得的价格已大幅上涨。【原文：The prices importers can get from selling rights to potential government refunds have surged in the wake of the U.S. Supreme Court’s ruling that President Donald Trump’s emergency tariffs are illegal.】

item.title: 纽约州要求特朗普政府退还135亿美元关税
item.description: 纽约州州长凯西·霍楚尔周二呼吁特朗普政府退还135亿美元关税，此前美国最高法院推翻了特朗普总统实施的大规模关税政策。【原文：New York Governor Kathy Hochul on Tuesday called on the Trump administration to issue $13.5 billion in tariff refunds after the U.S. Supreme Court struck down President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs.】

item.title: 巴西欢迎美国对飞机出口零关税
item.description: 巴西政府周二对华盛顿的决定表示欢迎，在近期美国贸易政策调整的背景下，华盛顿将巴西飞机进入美国的关税税率从原先的10%下调至免税水平。【原文：Brazil's government on Tuesday welcomed a decision by Washington to allow Brazilian aircraft to enter the United States duty-free, down from 10% previously, amid recent changes to U.S. trade policy.】

item.title: 澳大利亚WiseTech Global公司计划裁员2000人，以推进人工智能驱动的业务重组
item.description: 澳大利亚物流软件公司WiseTech Global周三表示，将在未来两年内裁员约2000人，以推动人工智能技术在其软件和内部运营中的全面应用。【原文：Australian logistics software firm WiseTech Global said on Wednesday it would lay off about 2,000 people over the next two years as it adopts artificial intelligence across its software and internal operations.】

item.title: 澳大利亚伍尔沃思中期利润超预期，得益于更注重预算的产品
item.description: 伍尔沃思周三公布中期基本利润上升，并指出市场份额趋于稳定的迹象。该公司正加大力度推出低价商品，以吸引注重性价比的顾客。【原文：Woolworths on Wednesday reported a rise in interim underlying profit and flagged signs of market share stabilization, as it ramped up efforts to attract value-conscious customers with lower-priced items.】

item.title: 两名美联储官员认为目前没有迫切需要改变货币政策
item.description: 周二，两名美联储官员表示短期内无意调整央行利率政策设置。【原文：Two Federal Reserve officials on Tuesday signaled no near-term appetite to change the setting of central bank interest rate policy.】
